Fitness

By MindBodyGreen

Actress, Kristen Bell graces the September issue of Shape magazine where she talks meditation, diet, fitness, and inspiration via Eleanor Roosevelt!"Do meditative yoga for 10 minutes every morning. When you have a problemwhether it's road rage, your guy, or workmeditation allows everything to unfold the way it's supposed to.""Eleanor Roosevelt's words: 'It's better to light a candle than to curse the darkness.'""Eleanor Roosevelt also said, 'When you cease to make a contribution, you begin to die.' I was raised to believe we were given two hands for a reason, and I feel more satisfied when I'm participating in the lives of others.""I like to keep moving whenever I can. And this is better than just sitting on the couch for an hour, right?... My friends and I are all into staying in shape through outdoor activities. We play Ultimate Frisbee, hike the trails around Los Angeles , go rock climbing in Malibu, explore underwater caves in Palos Verdes. We're gluttons for excitement, and it keeps us fit!""I like to stay fit and challenge myself. But I'm not going to try to be a certain size, or weigh a specific amount. I don't own a scale. My goal is to feel good and look healthy.""I've learned I don't really feel well after I eat it. But I also know that devouring a whole cheesecake with my girlfriends can feel incredible! I'm always going to be the kind of person who treats myself."Check out Kristen's full '30 Rules to Live By' at Shape here

Published 08.19.10 at 04:00 PM
title: Kristen Bell Covers Shape Magazine: Talks Diet, Fitness & Meditation
